title: Morphine Milligram Equivalents (MME) Calculator
description: Calculates total daily morphine milligram equivalents to assess opioid dosing, guide safe prescribing practices, and evaluate overdose risk.

parameters.name: opioid_medications
parameters.description: JSON array of opioid medications with dosing details: [{"medication": "morphine", "dose": 30, "frequency_per_day": 2, "route": "oral"}]

ranges.interpretation: MME <50 mg/day: Standard monitoring and counseling on opioid safety recommended.
MME 50-89 mg/day: Increased monitoring, consider tapering, review benefits vs risks, naloxone prescription recommended.
MME ≥90 mg/day: High-risk dosing. Careful evaluation of benefits vs risks, consider tapering, naloxone prescription essential, frequent monitoring required.

references: Dowell D, Haegerich TM, Chou R. CDC Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain--United States, 2016. JAMA. 2016;315(15):1624-45. doi: 10.1001/jama.2016.1464.
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. CDC Clinical Practice Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Pain — United States, 2022. MMWR Recomm Rep. 2022;71(3):1-95. doi: 10.15585/mmwr.rr7103a1.
Nielsen S, Degenhardt L, Hoban B, Gisev N. A synthesis of oral morphine equivalents (OME) for opioid utilisation studies. Pharmacoepidemiol Drug Saf. 2016;25(6):733-7. doi: 10.1002/pds.3945.
formula: MME = Σ(Daily Dose × Conversion Factor) for each opioid medication. Conversion factors based on CDC guidelines and established pharmacokinetic data.
notes: Based on CDC 2022 Clinical Practice Guideline for Prescribing Opioids
Conversion factors may vary between sources - CDC factors used here
MME ≥50 mg/day associated with increased overdose risk
MME ≥90 mg/day associated with significantly increased overdose risk
Consider tapering when MME ≥50 mg/day without clear benefit
Naloxone prescription recommended for MME ≥50 mg/day
Conversion factors apply to chronic, steady-state dosing
Acute post-operative dosing may require different considerations
Fentanyl patches calculated based on 72-hour dosing
Incomplete cross-tolerance may require dose reduction when rotating opioids
Individual patient factors affect actual equivalency
Use clinical judgment in addition to calculated MME
Monitor for signs of oversedation or respiratory depression
Document rationale for high MME dosing
Consider consultation with pain specialists for complex cases
